intro: Alcantarea duarteana, commonly known as the Duarte's Cactus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
